lichterkette

Class LichterKette

  • java.lang.Object
    • lichterkette.LichterKette

  • public class LichterKette
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple LichterKette Class, used to simulate a strip of LEDs

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public LED remove(int index)
        Removes the element at the specified position in this LichterKette. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices).
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element to be removed
        Returns:
        the element that was removed from the list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • remove

        public void remove(LED... leds)
        Removes the first occurrence of the specified elements from this list, if it is present. If the LichterKette does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index i such that Objects.equals(o, get(i)) (if such an element exists).
        Parameters:
        leds - elements to be removed from this list, if present

      • get

        public LED get(int index)
        Returns the led at the specified position in this list.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the led to return
        Returns:
        the led at the specified position in this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • add

        public void add(LED... leds)
        Appends the specified elements to the end of this list.
        Parameters:
        leds - elements to be appended to this list

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<LED> listToAdd)
        Appends all of the elements in the specified collection to the end of this LichterKette, in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's Iterator. The behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress. (This implies that the behavior of this call is undefined if the specified collection is this list, and this list is nonempty.)
        Parameters:
        collection - collection containing elements to be added to this list
        Returns:
        true if this list changed as a result of the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null

      • forEach

        public void forEach(<any> action)
        Performs the given action for each element of the LichterKette until all elements have been processed or the action throws an exception. Actions are performed in the order of iteration, if that order is specified. Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller.

        The behavior of this method is unspecified if the action performs side-effects that modify the underlying source of LEDs.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        size of the LichterKette

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int newSize)
        Resizes the LichterKette
        Parameters:
        newSize - new size for the LichterKette

      • setActive

        public void setActive(int index,
                      boolean state)
        Activates LED at given Index
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the LED that should be activated
        state - State that the LEDs should be set to

      • setActiveMultiple

        public void setActiveMultiple(int position,
                              int length,
                              boolean state)
        Activates Multiple LEDs 
         Example:
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
     |                                          length                            |    
     |                                          ---->                             |    
     |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | ( 2,  2) => [o, o, S, S, o, o] | o = old & S = state |
     |                                    ------>                                 |
     |                                    position                                | 
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
     |                                            length                          |
     |                                            <----                           |
     |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (-2, -2) => [o, o, o, S, S, o] | o = old & S = state |
     |                                                <---                        | 
     |                                             position                       |  
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        position - Position to start from
        length - The length
        state - State that the LEDs should be set tos

      • setActiveInGaps

        public void setActiveInGaps(int gapSize,
                            boolean state)
        Activates LEDs in with gaps 
         Example:
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (1) => [o, S, o, S, o, S] | o = old & S = state  |
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        gapSize - The gapSize
        state - State that the LEDs should be set to

      • setActiveInGaps

        public void setActiveInGaps(int position,
                            int length,
                            int gapSize,
                            boolean state)
        Activates LEDs in with gaps from 
         Example:
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 |                                             length                           |
 |                                           --------->                         |
 |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (2, 4, 1) => [o, o, S, o, S, o] | o = old & S = State  |
 |                                     ------>                                  |
 |                                     position                                 |
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        position - Position from where to start from
        length - The Length
        gapSize - The GapSize
        state - State that the LEDs should be set to

      • setRGB

        public void setRGB(int index,
                   int rgb)
        Activates LED
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the LED that should be changed in Color
        rgb - Color the LED should be set to

      • setRGBMultiple

        public void setRGBMultiple(int position,
                           int length,
                           int rgb)
        Activates Multiple LEDs 
         Example:
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
     |                                          length                            |    
     |                                          ---->                             |    
     |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | ( 2,  2) => [o, o, R, R, o, o] | o = old & R = rgb   |
     |                                    ------>                                 |
     |                                    position                                | 
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
     |                                            length                          |
     |                                            <----                           |
     |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (-2, -2) => [o, o, o, R, R, o] | o = old & R = rgb   |
     |                                                <---                        | 
     |                                             position                       |  
     +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        position - Position to start from
        length - The length
        rgb - Color that the LEDs should be set to

      • setRGBInGaps

        public void setRGBInGaps(int gapSize,
                         int rgb)
        Activates LEDs in with gaps 
         Example:
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (1) => [o, R, o, R, o, R] | o = old & R = rgb    |
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        gapSize - The gapSize
        rgb - Color that the LEDs should be set to

      • setRGBInGaps

        public void setRGBInGaps(int position,
                         int length,
                         int gapSize,
                         int rgb)
        Activates LEDs in with gaps from 
         Example:
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 |                                             length                           |
 |                                           --------->                         |
 |  [o, o, o, o, o, o] | (2, 4, 1) => [o, o, R, o, R, o] | o = old & R = rgb    |
 |                                     ------>                                  |
 |                                     position                                 |
 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        Parameters:
        position - Position from where to start from
        length - The Length
        gapSize - The GapSize
        rgb - Color that the LEDs should be set to

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this licterKette. The string representation consists of a list of the licterKette's elements in the order they are returned by its iterator, enclosed in square brackets ("[]"). Adjacent elements are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). Elements are converted to strings as by String.valueOf(Object).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this licterKette
